00035 /* for O_DIRECTORY */
00036 #ifndef _GNU_SOURCE
00037 #define _GNU_SOURCE
00038 #endif
00039 
00040 #include <stdio.h>
00041 #include <stdlib.h>
00042 #include <unistd.h>
00043 #include <errno.h>
00044 #include <fcntl.h>
00045 #include <sys/types.h>
00046 #include <sys/stat.h>
00047 #include <dirent.h>
00048 #include <string.h>
00049 
00050 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00051 {
00052         char *dname1, *dname2;
00053         int fddir1, fddir2, rc;
00054         //DIR *dp;
00055         struct stat st1, st2;
00056 
00057         if (argc < 2 || argc > 3) {
00058                 fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s dirname1 [dirname2]\n", argv[0]);
00059                 exit(1);
00060         }
00061 
00062         dname1 = argv[1];
00063         if (argc == 3)
00064                 dname2 = argv[2];
00065         else
00066                 dname2 = argv[1];
00067 
00068         //create the directory
00069         fprintf(stderr, "creating directory %s\n", dname1);
00070         rc = mkdir(dname1, 0744);
00071         if (rc == -1) {
00072                 fprintf(stderr, "creating %s fails: %s\n", 
00073                         dname1, strerror(errno));
00074                 exit(1);
00075         }
00076 
00077         // open the dir again
00078         fprintf(stderr, "opening directory\n");
00079         fddir1 = open(dname1, O_RDONLY | O_DIRECTORY);
00080         if (fddir1 == -1) {
00081                 fprintf(stderr, "open %s fails: %s\n",
00082                         dname1, strerror(errno));
00083                 exit(2);
00084         }
00085         
00086         // doesn't matter if the two dirs are the same??
00087         fddir2 = open(dname2, O_RDONLY | O_DIRECTORY);
00088         if (fddir2 == -1) {
00089                 fprintf(stderr, "open %s fails: %s\n",
00090                         dname2, strerror(errno));
00091                 exit(3);
00092         }
00093         
00094         // another method
00095 /*        
00096         if ( (dp = opendir(dname2)) == NULL) {
00097                 fprintf(stderr, "opendir() %s\n", strerror(errno));
00098                 exit(1);
00099         }
00100         fddir = dirfd(dp);
00101 */
00102 
00103         // delete the dir
00104         fprintf (stderr, "unlinking %s\n", dname1);
00105         rc = rmdir(dname1);
00106         if (rc) {
00107                 fprintf(stderr, "unlink %s error: %s\n", 
00108                         dname1, strerror(errno));
00109                 exit(4);
00110         }
00111 
00112         if (access(dname2, F_OK) == 0){
00113                 fprintf(stderr, "%s still exists\n", dname2);
00114                 exit(5);
00115         }
00116 
00117         if (access(dname1, F_OK) == 0){
00118                 fprintf(stderr, "%s still exists\n", dname1);
00119                 exit(6);
00120         }
00121 
00122         // fchmod the dir
00123         rc = fchmod (fddir1, 0777);
00124         if(rc == -1)
00125         {
00126                 fprintf(stderr, "fchmod unlinked dir fails %s\n", 
00127                         strerror(errno));
00128                 exit(7);
00129         }
00130                 
00131         // fstat two dirs to check if they are the same
00132         rc = fstat(fddir1, &st1);
00133         if(rc == -1)
00134         {
00135                 fprintf(stderr, "fstat unlinked dir %s fails %s\n", 
00136                         dname1, strerror(errno));
00137                 exit(8);
00138         }
00139 
00140         rc = fstat(fddir2, &st2);
00141         if (rc == -1) {
00142                 fprintf(stderr, "fstat dir %s fails %s\n",
00143                         dname2, strerror(errno));
00144                 exit(9);
00145         }
00146 
00147         if (st1.st_mode != st2.st_mode) {  // can we do this?
00148                 fprintf(stderr, "fstat different value on %s and %s\n",                                 dname1, dname2);
00149                 exit(10);
00150         }        
00151 
00152         fprintf(stderr, "Ok, everything goes well.\n");
00153         return 0;
00154 }
